commit_message:
Remove seamingly unused cmd2 dependency

cmd2 was brought in as a dependency here:

https://review.opendev.org/#/c/570972/

As long as we used python 2, we needed to cap cmd2.
However, some time ago we switched to Python3 as part
of https://review.opendev.org/#/c/581193/ so the cap
is no longer needed.

Change-Id: I677168980f7fbabbf388d377eb20ce8b01a3b4b1

commit_message:
Define ovn_dbs_image fact for upgrades.

The ovn upgrade_tasks make use of a block which belongs
to the update_tasks. In that block, the ovs_dbs_image
variable is being referenced. However, the fact is set
in a step before the block invoked.

This patch sets ovn_dbs_image fact in step0 for upgrade
tasks and fixes a small typo with the bundle.

Change-Id: I1d24dce0ff9c88380e8769593d619a9e4e944e40
Closes-Bug: #1851669
(cherry picked from commit 460d4771a6be1b7aebc8c86263149e2835cad654)

commit_message:
Log more detail for Etcd3Exceptions

As of https://github.com/dims/etcd3-gateway/pull/31 and
https://github.com/dims/etcd3-gateway/pull/32, etcd3-gateway's
Etcd3Exception can report additional information, in its detail_text
field, when an HTTP request from Calico to the grpc gateway gets a
failure response.

This change updates the networking-calico code to include that
detail_text content in logging.

Change-Id: If8bde036b750a3610d68024fe88482fdf1303d04

Instead of doing a recursive chown on /srv/node, chown only /srv/node
and any immediate subdirectory under /srv/node.

commit_message:
swift-rsyncd: don't recursively chown /srv/node at startup

Instead of doing a recursive chown on /srv/node, chown only /srv/node
and any immediate subdirectory under /srv/node.

Change-Id: I8fd93fa77ba9fc63910360300b8783a34bd4e6d5
Closes-Bug: #1851169
(cherry picked from commit 2d122afaf9817cadc668b308c4f736e47c09a55f)

We still need to move migration to ussuri, here's fixing patch (alternative) https://review.opendev.org/#/c/692285/"}, {'account_id': 13252, 'date': '2019-10-31 09:24:26.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Code-Review-1

O.k., I agree now that fixing the migration like in https://review.opendev.org/692285 is better.'}, {'account_id': 16688, 'date': '2019-10-31 10:12:26.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

> I would not recommend reverting migrations. The proper way to fix -
 > update merged code to fix issues, unless migration is totally
 > wrong.

The problem here is that the index added to the NetworkDhcpAgentBinding table is not being used now. This index has no autoincrement ability and the code does not make use of it.

Although https://review.opendev.org/#/c/692285/ is fixing the UTs, this code is not going to work in an environment with more that one agent per network, because the binding_index won't increase automatically and the constrain introduced "uniq_network_dhcp_agent_binding0network_id0binding_index0" will fail.'}, {'account_id': 11975, 'date': '2019-10-31 10:41:50.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

> > I would not recommend reverting migrations. The proper way to fix
 > -
 > > update merged code to fix issues, unless migration is totally
 > > wrong.
 > 
 > The problem here is that the index added to the NetworkDhcpAgentBinding
 > table is not being used now. This index has no autoincrement
 > ability and the code does not make use of it.
 > 
 > Although https://review.opendev.org/#/c/692285/ is fixing the UTs,
 > this code is not going to work in an environment with more that one
 > agent per network, because the binding_index won't increase
 > automatically and the constrain introduced "uniq_network_dhcp_agent_binding0network_id0binding_index0"
 > will fail.

I agree with Rodolfo here. Lets revert it for now to unblock the gate, especially that this broke also neutron-dynamic-routing jobs as well. And later we can propose it again with fixed migration scripts and addressed other issues.'}, {'account_id': 5948, 'date': '2019-10-31 11:43:46.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

Copying here my comment from https://review.opendev.org/#/c/692285/: binding index assignment is handled in dhcp_agent_scheduler: https://review.opendev.org/#/c/288271/28/neutron/scheduler/dhcp_agent_scheduler.py - autoincrement was only needed for transition.'}, {'account_id': 16688, 'date': '2019-11-01 10:45:26.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4:

This is going to be more complex than just fixing the DB field and the tests. In sake of avoiding DB migration problems and fixing the CI ASAP, let's go for https://review.opendev.org/#/c/692285/"}, {'account_id': 11975, 'date': '2019-11-02 12:23:48.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

recheck'}, {'account_id': 26622, 'date': '2019-11-02 14:11:35.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

For rechecking only on the Cloudbase Neutron Hyper-V CI, add a review comment with run-Cloudbase Neutron Hyper-V CI

- neutron http://cloudbase-ci.com/neutron/691710/4 : FAILURE in 1h 46m 53s'}, {'account_id': 1131, 'date': '2019-11-06 08:29:05.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned

Fix-up patch merge, no longer needed.'}, {'account_id': 16643, 'date': '2019-11-09 00:47:24.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4:

> Fix-up patch merge, no longer needed.

Hi Brian, 

What is the patch that fixes this bug (https://launchpad.net/bugs/1849976)? 

We run several jobs on manila that setup a neutron bgp speaker to do route advertisements for tenant networks that tempest creates. These jobs are currently broken due to LP 1849976 and the tests can't connect to the nova servers on these tenant networks. Is there a fix being pursued?"}, {'account_id': 16643, 'date': '2019-11-09 00:51:09.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4:

> Hi Brian, 
> What is the patch that fixes this bug (https://launchpad.net/bugs/1849976)? 
> We run several jobs on manila that setup a neutron bgp speaker to do route advertisements for tenant networks that tempest creates. These jobs are currently broken due to LP 1849976 and the tests can't connect to the nova servers on these tenant networks. Is there a fix being pursued?

I meant to cite https://bugs.launchpad.net/manila/+bug/1850626 - which I presume is somehow related to this revert patch, because the workaround in the neutron gate (https://review.opendev.org/#/c/692372/) references this revert patch."}, {'account_id': 13252, 'date': '2019-11-11 12:30:16.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4:

@Goutham: a) People very rarely look at merged or abandoned patches, this is not a good way to reach somebody's attention.
b) There is indeed an issue in neutron-dynamic-routing introduced by this patch, I'll try to come up with a fix and add it to the bug report."}]

commit_message:
Revert "Add binding_index to NetworkDhcpAgentBinding"

This reverts commit 69b3762dda47272513e02340e7942d5a39f825c5.

Conflicts:
        neutron/db/migration/alembic_migrations/versions/EXPAND_HEAD
        neutron/tests/unit/objects/test_objects.py

Closes-bug: #1849976
Change-Id: I18ff3b434cf62267ef26f90f00096ab812d0b4b4

So, The error occurs during run stack.sh like below.

[ERROR] /opt/stack/devstack/stackrc:780
http://download.cirros-cloud.net/0.4.0/cirros-0.4.0-x86_64-disk.img is

commit_message:
Remove image_urls of CirrOS in local.conf.example

CirrOS is default image in latest devstack.
So, The error occurs during run stack.sh like below.

[ERROR] /opt/stack/devstack/stackrc:780
http://download.cirros-cloud.net/0.4.0/cirros-0.4.0-x86_64-disk.img is
duplicate, please remove it from IMAGE_URLS.

Change-Id: Id5a2d06a4c006f042a33fd68fb1b77be7513ee04

Only stop chrony on nodes in kolla inventory

If docker is not installed this task will currently fail.

>Why are you removing the admin ctx here? "get_l3_agents_hosting_routers" is calling "get_admin_state_up_filter" too. You'll miss some registers here.
I wasn't aware of that. Will add it back.

>"get_hosts_to_notify" is calling "get_l3_agents_hosting_routers", but you claim the last function does not return the L3 agents for DVR routers.
`plugin` here is a mixin of multiple classes. Among them are the `L3AgentSchedulerDbMixin` that you linked but also `L3_DVRsch_db_mixin` which overrides `get_hosts_to_notify` to also return dvr routers [1].

commit_message:
Send notifications about DVR routers to L3 agents

The get_l3_agents_hosting_routers function doesn't return l3 agents for
DVR routers. get_hosts_to_notify properly returns hosts for both DVR and
non-DVR routers.

Partial-Bug: #1807157
Change-Id: I68ac816b08acabbba5fcaa24d3f53b50712061bb

(2 comments)'}, {'account_id': 28655, 'date': '2019-07-01 13:36:38.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

>1) Add more description here in the commit message.
Read the bug report. This change is pretty self-explanatory.

>2) Add a release note. We are modifying some counters available for the user. IMO, we should inform about this.
This change alone doesn't change any behavior. There are multiple problems with metering for DVR routers. See the last comment in https://review.opendev.org/#/c/621165/ for a list of all my changes attempting to fix that. All except https://review.opendev.org/#/c/666970/ are needed for DVR routers to actually start working properly.

>3) Add testing, please.
I will try to.

I won't make the proposed code change. The counters need to be summed up. `chain_acc.update` would overwrite the counters returned by `rm.iptables_manager.get_traffic_counters`."}, {'account_id': 28655, 'date': '2019-07-06 15:12:06.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 28655, 'date': '2019-07-06 15:13:38.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

commit_message:
Count traffic on the SNAT namespace

Traffic on the SNAT namespace should be counted and summed with the
counters on the main namespace.

Change-Id: I700f19753436c90337ff941550a990e7c5da2685
Partial-Bug: #1807157

commit_message:
Communicate DVR routers to the metering agent

The function list_routers_on_l3_agent doesn't return DVR routers running
on the host. list_router_ids_on_host should be used instead.

Partial-Bug: #1807157
Change-Id: I8a9a5168291a6d1069d08fe1b64bda31960ee8f2

[{'created': '2019-02-07 22:06:10.000000000', 'message': 'WIP: Execute CrossCellMigrationTask from MigrationTask

This adds the code to check if a cross-cell move is
allowed by the RequestSpec, which is set in the API,
and if so, checks to see if the scheduler selected
a host in another cell. If so, then CrossCellMigrationTask
is executed.

Part of blueprint cross-cell-resize

commit_message:
Execute CrossCellMigrationTask from MigrationTask

This adds the code to check if a cross-cell move is
allowed by the RequestSpec, which is set in the API,
and if so, checks to see if the scheduler selected
a host in another cell. If so, then CrossCellMigrationTask
is executed.

Note the _restrict_request_spec_to_cell method gets
renamed and logging is adjusted since we may not be
restricting the scheduler to hosts in the same cell
if cross-cell moves are allowed.

Part of blueprint cross-cell-resize

Change-Id: Ibaa31fc8079c16e169472372c05dc48ff0602515

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-10-28 06:35:05.000000000', 'message': 'Handle OVSFWPortNotFound and OVSFWTagNotFound in ovs firewall

This will prevent ovs agent from endless fail loop when dealing
with unbound port: like when port was created in neutron before
agent become alive, then agent gets online and and starts processing
devices.
This patch adds exception handling to prepare_port_filter() -
same as done in update_port_filter().

Change-Id: I1137eb18efaf51c67fab145e645f58cbd3772e40
Closes-Bug: #1849098
(cherry picked from commit e801159003978f7c5c67eb3e9fe36fa690656d77)
'}]
commit_message:
Handle OVSFWPortNotFound and OVSFWTagNotFound in ovs firewall

This will prevent ovs agent from endless fail loop when dealing
with unbound port: like when port was created in neutron before
agent become alive, then agent gets online and and starts processing
devices.
This patch adds exception handling to prepare_port_filter() -
same as done in update_port_filter().

Change-Id: I1137eb18efaf51c67fab145e645f58cbd3772e40
Closes-Bug: #1849098
(cherry picked from commit e801159003978f7c5c67eb3e9fe36fa690656d77)

[{'created': '2019-11-11 08:39:21.000000000', 'message': '[manila] Fixes manila-share on debian/ubuntu

manila-share cannot start on debian/ubuntu because python3-cephfs is missing.

Change-Id: Ia592dda4ee20979c701efe6007f236dba9848997
Closes-Bug: #1851692
(cherry picked from commit 1d5a208c2e5c81ed4169c63d1d5ea0ad31b78f2f)
'}]
commit_message:
[manila] Fixes manila-share on debian/ubuntu

manila-share cannot start on debian/ubuntu because python3-cephfs is missing.

Change-Id: Ia592dda4ee20979c701efe6007f236dba9848997
Closes-Bug: #1851692
(cherry picked from commit 1d5a208c2e5c81ed4169c63d1d5ea0ad31b78f2f)

commit_message:
Fix network hostnames in tripleo-hosts-entries

The previous Heat behavior used the jinja2 lower() filter on the network
name to create the hostnames, not network.name_lower. As
network.name_lower can container underscores, this was causing an issue
since the expected hostnames were not present in /etc/hosts.

This patch corrects the issue by switching to just using the lower()
filter.

Change-Id: Ia02ca1263590e2b579f2534e99119d7b1cd4b39a

swift-rsyncd: don't recursively chown /srv/node at startup

Instead of doing a recursive chown on /srv/node, chown only /srv/node
and any immediate subdirectory under /srv/node.

Change-Id: I8fd93fa77ba9fc63910360300b8783a34bd4e6d5
Closes-Bug: #1851169
(cherry picked from commit 2d122afaf9817cadc668b308c4f736e47c09a55f)

commit_message:
swift-rsyncd: don't recursively chown /srv/node at startup

Instead of doing a recursive chown on /srv/node, chown only /srv/node
and any immediate subdirectory under /srv/node.

Change-Id: I8fd93fa77ba9fc63910360300b8783a34bd4e6d5
Closes-Bug: #1851169
(cherry picked from commit 2d122afaf9817cadc668b308c4f736e47c09a55f)

commit_message:
Update kubernetes-entrypoint image reference

This updates the kubernetes-entrypoint image reference to consume
the publicly available kubernetes-entrypoint image that is built
and maintained under the airshipit namespace, as the stackanetes
image is no longer actively maintained

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/688435

Change-Id: I7f48605f08f574822179d51cd645ded07714d9c3
Signed-off-by: Steve Wilkerson <sw5822@att.com>

commit_message:
Add missing pod labels for CronJobs

Pods for some of the CronJobs do not have correct
application and component labels applied, they are
unable to start if Network Policies are enabled.

Related-Change: Ie4eed0e9829419b4b2e40e9b712b73a86d6fc3d2
Change-Id: Ieee874bf837c7947e3681e0447d150174c99d880

I think there is some confusion as there is no project_id in the "get quota defaults" method.'}, {'account_id': 29870, 'date': '2019-10-29 00:52:12.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 29870, 'date': '2019-11-11 09:30:01.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

I think there is some inconsistence between doc and code in the "get default quota" method.One defines the default quota in deploment scope, while the other one defines it in project scope. Either looks good.

If we think the pricinple of defining in deployment scope used by doc is what we should follow, then we should modify code. And vice versa,
that's what my change is doing.'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2019-10-26 08:06:33.000000000', 'message': "Fix wrong urls in Quota API

In the Octavia v2 API implemention, the url of getting project
default quota is 'quotas/{project_id}/defaults', which is wrong
about 'quotas/defaults' in API doc, So we fix it

Change-Id: I8cdc7eac65be4b3fa1fe444c769a51ce60469263
"}]
commit_message:
Fix wrong urls in Quota API

In the Octavia v2 API implemention, the url of getting project
default quota is 'quotas/{project_id}/defaults', which is wrong
about 'quotas/defaults' in API doc, So we fix it

Change-Id: I8cdc7eac65be4b3fa1fe444c769a51ce60469263

I downloaded Your patch on local devstack and tried to use it. I see some problems still:

1. Your new API extension is not available on ext-list so feature is not discoverable by client tools  - You should add it to list of supported extensions in ML2 or propose service plugin with this feature,
2. Even when API extension is not available on ext-list, feature works (but not properly)
3. For router:external network (called "public" in devstack) I have configured is_default to true and it's fine,
4. For tenant network I see few problems:
4a. During creation of new network I got in result json field "is_default" but in net-show there is no this field for networks different than router:external=True,
4b. even if I set is_default=True it is not stored in Neutron's database and network is not set as default

So basically for me this patch don't work properly. Please verify it on Your side and fix issue which I pointed here :)'}, {'account_id': 11975, 'date': '2018-01-23 10:48:00.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 31:

Additionally, I think that some fullstack test to test this feature would be useful also'}, {'account_id': 27654, 'date': '2018-01-26 20:11:31.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 31:

> I downloaded Your patch on local devstack and tried to use it. I
 > see some problems still:
 > 
 > 1. Your new API extension is not available on ext-list so feature
 > is not discoverable by client tools  - You should add it to list of
 > supported extensions in ML2 or propose service plugin with this
 > feature,
 > 2. Even when API extension is not available on ext-list, feature
 > works (but not properly)
 > 3. For router:external network (called "public" in devstack) I have
 > configured is_default to true and it's fine,
 > 4. For tenant network I see few problems:
 > 4a. During creation of new network I got in result json field
 > "is_default" but in net-show there is no this field for networks
 > different than router:external=True,
 > 4b. even if I set is_default=True it is not stored in Neutron's
 > database and network is not set as default
 > 
 > So basically for me this patch don't work properly. Please verify
 > it on Your side and fix issue which I pointed here :)

If you don't see the extension in neutron ext-list, that means this feature is not enabled at all. The tests you performed seems to be against the auto_allocate extension instead of this one. The behavior you saw is similar as what this bug described: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/538331/

However, to test this patch, I would suggest to ensure the new extension is on the list first. Probably, you need to modify the ml2 config file (/etc/neutron/plugins/ml2/ml2_conf.ini) to add 'default_networks' to the extension_drivers list.'}, {'account_id': 27654, 'date': '2018-01-26 20:11:45.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 31:

> Additionally, I think that some fullstack test to test this feature
 > would be useful also

Sure, I will try that.'}, {'account_id': 27654, 'date': '2018-01-26 20:16:53.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 31:

A question. Should this feature be implemented as ML2 extension driver or as a service plugin? Both options have been suggested by reviewers and we need to pick one.'}, {'account_id': 27654, 'date': '2018-01-26 23:44:00.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 32.'}, {'account_id': 19853, 'date': '2018-01-29 03:29:10.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 32: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 11975, 'date': '2018-01-29 08:55:40.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 32: Code-Review-1

Extension driver is something else than service plugin and API extension. I didn't see it in extensions list because it is not added to supported_extensions in https://github.com/openstack/neutron/blob/master/neutron/plugins/ml2/plugin.py#L147 or in service plugin, like e.g. qos is doing: https://github.com/openstack/neutron/blob/master/neutron/services/qos/qos_plugin.py#L43

If You are saying me that I was using some different "is_default" option instead of proposed by You than IMO You should consider to change Your option name. Otherwise it might confuse users which option they are currently using.'}, {'account_id': 27654, 'date': '2018-01-31 00:13:32.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 33.'}, {'account_id': 11975, 'date': '2018-01-31 13:52:42.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 32:

> 
 > If You are saying me that I was using some different "is_default"
 > option instead of proposed by You than IMO You should consider to
 > change Your option name. Otherwise it might confuse users which
 > option they are currently using.

I think you are right. While working on the documentation of this feature, I figured out that this is indeed very confusing. This is because both extensions are trying to use the same attribute (is_default) for different purposes and there is no clear way to communicate this with users.

Following are the alternative approaches I can think of:

Option #1: Rename the existing attribute 'is_default' to 'is_external_default'. The outcome will be:

* AutoAllocatedTopology -> is_external_default
* DefaultNetworks -> is_default

Option #2: Rename the new attribute to 'is_tenant_default'. The output will be:

* AutoAllocatedTopology -> is_default
* DefaultNetwork -> is_tenant_default

Thoughts?'}, {'account_id': 27654, 'date': '2018-02-09 22:20:34.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 40: Code-Review-1

Awaiting for inputs about the naming of the attribute.'}, {'account_id': 27654, 'date': '2018-03-15 22:32:07.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 41: Commit message was updated.'}, {'account_id': 11536, 'date': '2018-03-15 22:33:19.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 41: Workflow-1'}, {'account_id': 27654, 'date': '2018-03-16 22:20:50.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 42.'}, {'account_id': 27654, 'date': '2018-03-16 22:47:49.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 43.'}, {'account_id': 27654, 'date': '2018-03-17 19:30:51.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 44: Commit message was updated.'}, {'account_id': 1653, 'date': '2018-03-18 08:24:17.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 45: Patch Set 44 was rebased'}, {'account_id': 11975, 'date': '2018-03-26 10:57:50.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 45: Code-Review-1

'}, {'created': '2017-10-24 18:55:41.000000000', 'message': "Add is_default to Network

Introduce an attribute 'is_default' to network. This attribute indicates
if a network is a default network. If a network is created or updated
as default, neutron will ensure the following:
* At most one default external network exists globally.
* At most one default shared network exists globally.
* At most one default network exists per-tenant.

This patch introduces an 'is_default' column in networks table. Note that
there is another 'is_default' attribute existed in the externalnetworks
table. For now, we allow both attributes co-existed to satisfy the
requirements of online db migration. The following strategy is proposed:
* If a network is created, the 'is_default' column of both networks and
  externalnetworks tables will be populated.
* If a network is updated, the 'is_default' column of both networks and
  externalnetworks tables will be updated if necessary.
* If a network is queried, read from externalnetworks table if the network
  is external, otherwise, read from networks table.

The goal is to allow both older and newer version of neutron components
co-existed. Once we reach a point in time that contract migration is
allowed for Queens, another patch should follow to drop the 'is_default'
column from externalnetworks table.

Change-Id: I465ea140910af50d62ab281d26357861cf96952b
Partial-Bug: #1690439
"}, {'created': '2017-11-14 23:58:48.000000000', 'message': "Add is_default to Network

Introduce an attribute 'is_default' to network. This attribute indicates
if a network is a default network. If a network is created or updated
as default, neutron will ensure the following:
* At most one default external network exists globally.
* At most one default shared network exists globally.
* At most one default network exists per-tenant.

This patch introduces an 'is_default' column in networks table. Note that
there is another 'is_default' attribute in the externalnetworks
table. For now, we allow both attributes co-exist to satisfy the
requirements of online db migration. The following strategy is proposed:
* If a network is created, the 'is_default' column of both networks and
  externalnetworks tables will be populated.
* If a network is updated, the 'is_default' column of both networks and
  externalnetworks tables will be updated if necessary.
* If a network is queried, read from externalnetworks table if the network
  is external, otherwise, read from networks table.

The goal is to allow both older and newer version of neutron components
co-exist. Once we reach a point in time that contract migration is
allowed for Queens, another patch should follow to drop the 'is_default'
column from externalnetworks table.

APIImpact

Change-Id: I465ea140910af50d62ab281d26357861cf96952b
Partial-Bug: #1690439
"}, {'created': '2017-11-17 01:32:26.000000000', 'message': "[WIP] Add is_default to Network

Introduce an attribute 'is_default' to network. This attribute indicates
if a network is a default network. If a network is created or updated
as default, neutron will ensure the following:
* At most one default external network exists globally.
* At most one default shared network exists globally.
* At most one default network exists per-tenant.

This patch introduces an 'is_default' column in networks table. Note that
there is another 'is_default' attribute in the externalnetworks
table. For now, we allow both attributes co-exist to satisfy the
requirements of online db migration. The following strategy is proposed:
* If a network is created, the 'is_default' column of both networks and
  externalnetworks tables will be populated.
* If a network is updated, the 'is_default' column of both networks and
  externalnetworks tables will be updated if necessary.
* If a network is queried, read from externalnetworks table if the network
  is external, otherwise, read from networks table.

The goal is to allow both older and newer version of neutron components
co-exist. Once we reach a point in time that contract migration is
allowed for Queens, another patch should follow to drop the 'is_default'
column from externalnetworks table.

APIImpact

Change-Id: I465ea140910af50d62ab281d26357861cf96952b
Partial-Bug: #1690439

"}, {'created': '2018-02-09 20:49:56.000000000', 'message': "[WIP] Add is_default to Network

Introduce an attribute 'is_default' to network. This attribute indicates
if a network is a default network. If a network is created or updated
as default, neutron will ensure the following:
* At most one default external network exists globally.
* At most one default shared network exists globally.
* At most one default non-shared network exists per-tenant.

Note1: ML2 extension driver loaded on request via configuration:

  [ml2]
  extension_drivers = default_networks

Note2: This patch introduces an 'is_default' attribute in defaultnetworks
and there is another 'is_default' attribute in the externalnetworks.
The plan is to deprecate the one in externalnetworks and migrate to
defaultnetworks. Eventually, the 'is_default' attribute in externalnetworks
should be removed.

APIImpact Add 'is_default' attribute to 'network' resource
DocImpact Document the new 'is_default' attribute

Change-Id: I465ea140910af50d62ab281d26357861cf96952b
Partial-Bug: #1690439
Partial-Bug: #1745658
"}, {'created': '2018-03-15 22:32:07.000000000', 'message': "[WIP] Add is_project_default to Network

Introduce an attribute 'is_project_default' to network. This attribute
indicates if a network is a default network within its tenant.
If a network is created or updated as tenant default, neutron will ensure
at most one default network exists per-tenant.

Note1: ML2 extension driver loaded on request via configuration:

  [ml2]
  extension_drivers = default_networks

Note2: There is another network's attribute, called 'is_default', which
indicates if the network is external default. The preliminary plan is
to extend the existing 'is_default' attribute for tenant default but
this approach has several disadvantages, including the complexity on
data migration, upgrade, and ambiguous of semantic (the same attribute
is overloaded for two purposes: external default or tenant default).
Therefore, this patch proposes to introduce a new and independent
attribute to represent the tenant default network.

APIImpact Add 'is_project_default' attribute to 'network' resource
DocImpact Document the new 'is_project_default' attribute

Change-Id: I465ea140910af50d62ab281d26357861cf96952b
Partial-Bug: #1690439

commit_message:
Add project_default to Network

Introduce an attribute 'project_default' to network. This attribute
indicates if a network is a default network within its project.
If a network is created or updated as project default, neutron will
ensure at most one default network exists per-project.

Note1: ML2 extension driver loaded on request via configuration:

  [ml2]
  extension_drivers = project_default_network

Note2: There is another network's attribute, called 'is_default', which
indicates if the network is external default. The preliminary plan is
to extend the existing 'is_default' attribute for project default but
this approach has several disadvantages, including the complexity on
data migration, upgrade, and ambiguous of semantic (the same attribute
is overloaded for two purposes: external default or project default).
Therefore, this patch proposes to introduce a new and independent
attribute to represent the project default network.

Other related patches:
* nova spec: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/520247/
* neutron-lib: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/514110/
* tempest test: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/542446/

APIImpact Add 'project_default' attribute to 'network' resource
DocImpact Document the new 'project_default' attribute

Change-Id: I465ea140910af50d62ab281d26357861cf96952b
Partial-Bug: #1690439

commit_message:
[manila] Fixes manila-share on debian/ubuntu

manila-share cannot start on debian/ubuntu because python3-cephfs is missing.

Change-Id: Ia592dda4ee20979c701efe6007f236dba9848997
Closes-Bug: #1851692

Looking at log file produced by testing patch-set 59 it looks like there are two problems. 
1) It fails creating 1st heat stack:
 Error setting up fixture 'tobiko.openstack.stacks._neutron.NetworkStackFixture'
and because above stack is required it didn't start to setup Set up another fixture that requres it: 'tobiko.openstack.stacks._cirros.CirrosServerStackFixture'
2) Finally reporting test case problems tobiko tries to get a server ID from tobiko.openstack.stacks._cirros.CirrosServerStackFixture that where never created and it ends up producing another exception: tobiko.openstack.heat._stack.HeatStackNotFound: stack 'tobiko.openstack.stacks._cirros.CirrosServerStackFixture' not found

The first problem probably is caused from an error when obtaining a parameter to setup 'tobiko.openstack.stacks._neutron.NetworkStackFixture'. The actual problem is not finely printed out probably due to a limitation of the way parameters are fetched by HeatStackFixture class. The only visible information we have here is a BadRequest exception :-(

The second problem is indeed a dummy Tobiko framework bug (probably in CirrosServerStackFixture parent class) that didn't check the status of the stack before getting a server ID."}, {'account_id': 11975, 'date': '2019-09-20 15:21:26.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 61: Published edit on patch set 60.'}, {'account_id': 11975, 'date': '2019-09-23 06:29:55.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 61:

commit_message:
Add playbook and role to run tobiko

In Tobiko project we want to run job based on TripleO. To achieve that
we need to use some Tobiko specific playbooks which are added by this
patch.

This role will be used in Tobiko's TripleO based job which is
proposed in https://review.opendev.org/#/c/651828/

Change-Id: Ieffc859a92c8ef99dbc6d2c725d3c4bed8012b7a

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-11-06 22:07:59.000000000', 'message': 'mini-mirror: Add retries to package downloads

Currently, a single package download failure causes the mini-mirror
build job to fail. This change adds three retries [0] to package
downloads to circumvent intermittent download errors due to a bad
network connection.

An aptly version of 1.0.0 or greater is required for this feature.

[0] https://www.aptly.info/doc/aptly/mirror/update/

Change-Id: Ic186398a4fd93322060d5116325e8770ca92f35d
Signed-off-by: Drew Walters <andrew.walters@att.com>
'}, {'created': '2019-11-06 22:19:34.000000000', 'message': 'mini-mirror: Add retries to package downloads

Currently, a single package download failure causes the mini-mirror

commit_message:
mini-mirror: Add retries to package downloads

Currently, a single package download failure causes the mini-mirror
build job to fail. This change adds three retries [0] to package
downloads to circumvent intermittent download errors due to a bad
network connection.

An aptly version of 1.0.0 or greater is required for this feature.

[0] https://www.aptly.info/doc/aptly/mirror/update/

Change-Id: Ic186398a4fd93322060d5116325e8770ca92f35d
Signed-off-by: Drew Walters <andrew.walters@att.com>

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-11-06 21:21:34.000000000', 'message': 'mini-mirror: Use latest aptly version

Currently, the mini-mirror image job installs aptly from the standard
Ubuntu repositories. Consequently, the version of aptly used for the
Xenial build is 0.9.1 and differs from the version of aptly in the
Bionic build.

This change adds the official aptly repositories when installing aptly
in order to use the latest version and maintain consistency between the
two builds.

Change-Id: Ic2f79b0a910f0c0e3e2aff361dfe14c9b312f0f9
Signed-off-by: WALTERS, ANDREW (aw442m) <andrew.walters@att.com>

commit_message:
mini-mirror: Use latest aptly version

Currently, the mini-mirror image job installs aptly from the standard
Ubuntu repositories. Consequently, the version of aptly used for the
Xenial build is 0.9.1 and differs from the version of aptly in the
Bionic build.

This change adds the official aptly repositories when installing aptly
in order to use the latest version and maintain consistency between the
two builds.

Change-Id: Ic2f79b0a910f0c0e3e2aff361dfe14c9b312f0f9
Signed-off-by: Drew Walters <andrew.walters@att.com>

commit_message:
tox: Keeping going with docs

1. Sphinx 1.8 introduced [1] the '--keep-going' argument which, as its name
suggests, keeps the build running when it encounters non-fatal errors.
This is exceptionally useful in avoiding a continuous edit-build loop
when undertaking large doc reworks where multiple errors may be
introduced.

2. cleanup the exists folder before run sphinx-build command

[1] https://github.com/sphinx-doc/sphinx/commit/e3483e9b045

Change-Id: I6f53d424612af8788818d23ea43460444afc2172

commit_message:
Nagios http POST event handler timeout

The current timeout is very low and is not efficient.
A default value of 20s timeout is added.

Change-Id: I9a912776d13585a1fbd75c5fc4bc7a297b8e225e

commit_message:
Update apiversion

For k8s 1.16+, the extensions/v1beta1 has been replaced by
apps/v1 for DaemonSet. This patch set updates documents in
the OpenStack-Helm repository.

Change-Id: I8512b9f3202b2bf56b77408aca8d239daab32add
Signed-off-by: Tin Lam <tin@irrational.io>

Pin Patroni to v1.5.6

Pin the version of Patroni to v1.5.6 to prevent any issues that may
arise with using an new, untested version.

commit_message:
Increase test timeout for 2 tests in TestImageProxy class

The tests TestImageProxy.test_wait_for_task_error_396 and
TestImageProxy.test_wait_for_task_error_396 from
openstack.tests.unit.image.v2.test_proxy are failing in some build
environments with:

openstack.exceptions.ResourceTimeout: Timeout waiting for Task:id to \
    transition to success

Increasing the timeout hopefully helps.

Change-Id: I74714bfae1d488049d25701efcaad823b315631b

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-02-11 17:40:25.000000000', 'message': 'fix number of users for NeutronSubnets.delete_subnets

The NeutronSubnets.delete_subnets scenario assumes that the number of
users per tenant is greater or equal to the number of subnets per
network:

https://github.com/openstack/rally-openstack/blob/ed524c07c1559a4ed45c5f7eee78c4cac8a3450b/rally_openstack/scenarios/neutron/network.py

Note that `number` is set to the index of the user in the `users` list.
If there are fewer users than subnets, this means that a request to
delete the subnet is submitted more than once - resulting in
failures.

This change fixes the number of users per tenant to the same value as
the number of subnets per network. Additionally, we must use round robin
user selection to ensure that the same user is not selected twice.

Change-Id: I387705ad9c5ca9179b6079a49dd39ed9b9361a03
'}, {'created': '2019-08-27 11:15:16.000000000', 'message': 'fix number of users for NeutronSubnets.delete_subnets

network:

https://github.com/openstack/rally-openstack/blob/ed524c07c1559a4ed45c5f7eee78c4cac8a3450b/rally_openstack/scenarios/neutron/network.py

Note that `number` is set to the index of the user in the `users` list.
If there are fewer users than subnets, this means that a request to

This change fixes the number of users per tenant to the same value as
the number of subnets per network. Additionally, we must use round robin
user selection to ensure that the same user is not selected twice.

Change-Id: I387705ad9c5ca9179b6079a49dd39ed9b9361a03
'}, {'created': '2019-11-10 02:06:50.000000000', 'message': 'fix number of users for NeutronSubnets.delete_subnets

The NeutronSubnets.delete_subnets scenario assumes that the number of
users per tenant is greater or equal to the number of subnets per
network:

https://github.com/openstack/rally-openstack/blob/ed524c07c1559a4ed45c5f7eee78c4cac8a3450b/rally_openstack/scenarios/neutron/network.py

Note that `number` is set to the index of the user in the `users` list.
If there are fewer users than subnets, this means that a request to
delete the subnet is submitted more than once - resulting in
failures.

This change fixes the number of users per tenant to the same value as
the number of subnets per network. Additionally, we must use round robin
user selection to ensure that the same user is not selected twice.

Change-Id: I387705ad9c5ca9179b6079a49dd39ed9b9361a03
'}]
commit_message:
fix number of users for NeutronSubnets.delete_subnets

The NeutronSubnets.delete_subnets scenario assumes that the number of
users per tenant is greater or equal to the number of subnets per
network:

https://github.com/openstack/rally-openstack/blob/ed524c07c1559a4ed45c5f7eee78c4cac8a3450b/rally_openstack/scenarios/neutron/network.py

Note that `number` is set to the index of the user in the `users` list.
If there are fewer users than subnets, this means that a request to
delete the subnet is submitted more than once - resulting in
failures.

This change fixes the number of users per tenant to the same value as
the number of subnets per network. Additionally, we must use round robin
user selection to ensure that the same user is not selected twice.

Change-Id: I387705ad9c5ca9179b6079a49dd39ed9b9361a03

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-10-23 12:41:00.000000000', 'message': 'Fix search of max sequence number

It was observed that sometimes during
galera ckuster restart the node with highest
seqno is determined incorrecly. After investigation
it was found that max function is invoked on the
list of string values which can lead to incorrect results.
This patch performs casting the value to integer before building
list of seqnos hence max function will return correct result

Change-Id: I604ec837f3f2d157c829ab43a44e561879775c77
'}]
commit_message:
Fix search of max sequence number

It was observed that sometimes during
galera ckuster restart the node with highest
seqno is determined incorrecly. After investigation
it was found that max function is invoked on the
list of string values which can lead to incorrect results.
This patch performs casting the value to integer before building
list of seqnos hence max function will return correct result

Change-Id: I604ec837f3f2d157c829ab43a44e561879775c77

Add metal upgrade jobs

This patch adds jobs for both CentOS 7 and Ubuntu upgrades to
run in check and gate to ensure that we don't break upgrade paths.

[{'account_id': 30355, 'date': '2019-04-30 20:35:28.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 10068, 'date': '2019-04-30 20:51:15.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Thank you for your first contribution to OpenStack.

Your patch will now be tested automatically by OpenStack testing frameworks
and once the automatic tests pass, it will be reviewed by other friendly
developers. They will give you feedback and may require you to refine it.

People seldom get their patch approved on the first try, so don't be
concerned if requested to make corrections. Feel free to modify your patch
and resubmit a new change-set.

Patches usually take 3 to 7 days to be reviewed so be patient and be
available on IRC to ask and answer questions about your work. Also it
takes generally at least a couple of weeks for cores to get around to
reviewing code. The more you participate in the community the more
rewarding it is for you. You may also notice that the more you get to know
people and get to be known, the faster your patches will be reviewed and
eventually approved. Get to know others and become known by doing code
reviews: anybody can do it, and it's a great way to learn the code base.

Thanks again for supporting OpenStack, we look forward to working with you.

IRC: https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/IRC
Workflow: https://docs.openstack.org/infra/manual/developers.html
Commit Messages: https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/GitCommitMessages"}, {'account_id': 22713, 'date': '2019-04-30 21:18:16.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 30355, 'date': '2019-04-30 21:30:11.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 22713, 'date': '2019-05-01 14:35:40.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 29131, 'date': '2019-05-01 14:42:40.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 22713, 'date': '2019-05-01 16:38:30.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Patch Set 2 was rebased'}, {'account_id': 8898, 'date': '2019-05-10 16:15:16.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

(2 comments)'}, {'account_id': 30355, 'date': '2019-05-10 18:47:36.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

line 5  I was under the impression that container will run as 'nobody' account to provide shell login unless it's not required.
line 17  no this line is not required.  i take it out."}, {'account_id': 30355, 'date': '2019-05-10 19:56:59.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 30355, 'date': '2019-05-10 19:59:36.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 17068, 'date': '2019-05-13 11:33:39.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Code-Review-1

Could you explain why this container is required? I don't see why we are having this one in yet.
If you have a "Required-By: <other patch url>" in the commit message, pointing to a patch that would consume it, it would help understand, for example.

Please note that you need to add the zuul.d/ to build the image automatically here. If you don't intend to build the image automatically here, please write it down in the commit message. If you intend to add zuul image building later, please tell us here.'}, {'account_id': 30355, 'date': '2019-05-14 16:04:14.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 17068, 'date': '2019-05-14 16:41:09.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

> (1 comment)

Sure thing! The zuul.d/ folder contains all it needs to use the upstream CI build process in the context of openstack-helm.

In this case, you will find a lot of job files, explaining what to do, for example this one [1].

You can copy paste it, renaming the mariadb with mysql-client-utility.

With this in, you would basically build (and if this patch merges) automatically upload the image into openstackhelm's docker hub account.

My other question was the purpose of this -- I don't know what you really are trying to achieve that the current containers don't have, and in what context. All of this should be expressed in the commit message, so we don't wonder in 6 months time why we are carrying this container.

[1]: https://github.com/openstack/openstack-helm-images/blob/master/zuul.d/mariadb.yaml"}, {'account_id': 30355, 'date': '2019-05-15 15:11:01.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 4.'}, {'account_id': 29161, 'date': '2019-05-20 16:39:25.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

Line 45: please remove space.'}, {'account_id': 30355, 'date': '2019-05-23 20:45:05.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 6.'}, {'account_id': 17068, 'date': '2019-05-31 14:45:38.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6: Code-Review-1

Do we really need this?

Which chart will be consuming this?'}, {'account_id': 30355, 'date': '2019-05-31 19:07:26.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6:

Hello Pete,

this is similar to other UC.  This is for Porthole mysql-client utility chart relating to this PS relevant https://review.gerrithub.io/#/c/att-comdev/porthole/+/454701/'}, {'account_id': 29131, 'date': '2019-07-01 19:27:09.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 6: Code-Review-1

Please place it only in porthole repo."}, {'account_id': 29131, 'date': '2019-11-08 13:43:22.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 7: Patch Set 6 was rebased'}, {'account_id': 30784, 'date': '2019-11-08 15:50:43.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 8.'}, {'account_id': 30784, 'date': '2019-11-08 16:04:59.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 9.'}, {'account_id': 30784, 'date': '2019-11-08 16:11:54.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 10: Published edit on patch set 9.'}, {'account_id': 29131, 'date': '2019-11-08 16:54:43.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 11: Commit message was updated.'}, {'account_id': 20466, 'date': '2019-11-11 00:24:13.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned

Abandoning as requested.'}]

commit_message:
[Abandon] Feature is no longer needed. Trying to abandon it, but button not found

Add Dockerfile and make file for MySQL-Client-Utility container.
This container provides MySQL Client software to connect to
MySQL and MariaDB server.

Change-Id: I64064ab93bce0c341df2b6d319f49b391e77f142

As image should have been already cached in CI, we shouldn't
download it again but just verify the checksum.

NOTE - at the time of this commit download.cirros.com is not working
so the cirros image is also switched to 0.4.0 which is present in
the infra CI image.

(cherry-picked from commit ad4841f70a0ad4ed8090fc3f4c83812204cb59c0)
Change-Id: Ib764c70e483513bec5bd97d4499e67beb4501826
"}]
commit_message:
Don't download image when it's already there

As image should have been already cached in CI, we shouldn't
download it again but just verify the checksum.

NOTE - at the time of this commit download.cirros.com is not working
so the cirros image is also switched to 0.4.0 which is present in
the infra CI image.

(cherry-picked from commit ad4841f70a0ad4ed8090fc3f4c83812204cb59c0)
Change-Id: Ib764c70e483513bec5bd97d4499e67beb4501826

409 because we live migrate and failed, and vm state is conflict, we can't do some continue work, and it seems we could add some state check in these case to convenient us to find the wrong reason."}, {'account_id': 15888, 'date': '2018-03-26 09:39:09.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 5:

> We need adopt nova.tests.functional.regressions.test_bug_1595962.TestSerialConsoleLiveMigrate.test_serial_console_live_migrate.
 > 
 > and 409 code return is a little confusing, seems some unrelated.
 > but it fails all the time.

It is related, the tests created a live migration action before abort/force_complete, the mocked server seems to have the same host as the live migration destination host(self.compute.host) so the first action already failed due to the change. Thus the expected code didn't match for the rest calls."}, {'account_id': 6062, 'date': '2018-03-27 01:51:19.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 5:

commit_message:
Avoid live migrate to same host

As live migrate target to move instance to another host, we should
check at API layer before really do the action. This patch add
a check before calling conductor on whether host name is same.

Change-Id: I1333e9f888bb2994d0818a4498b20abe920aa23b
Closes-Bug: 1714235

commit_message:
Use subprocess securely

Due to https://docs.openstack.org/bandit/latest/plugins/subprocess_popen_with_shell_equals_true.html,
and reference https://security.openstack.org/guidelines/dg_avoid-shell-true.html and
https://security.openstack.org/guidelines/dg_use-subprocess-securely.html,
we should use python pipes to avoid shells and use subprocess more securely.

Closes-Bug: #1732363
Change-Id: Id4c92741dbe2e794c1be677874891468a03bc935

- check-nova-master http://extbasicopstackcilog01.podc.sl.edst.ibm.com/test_logs/jenkins-check-nova-master-8854 : SUCCESS in 2h 25m 40s'}, {'account_id': 8864, 'date': '2019-11-04 20:16:40.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 8: Code-Review-1

[1] would be required reading for anyone not already familiar with VM power management (like me).

I feel like we probably need a spec for this, because there are a lot of high level questions that need to be addressed.

The fact that this should be limited to only throttling CPUs that the VM is pinned to is reassuring (at least according to [1]), and alleviates the obvious concern of a VM being given a direct channel to a host agent.

Although what happens if there's a security flaw in the host agent? Now we suddenly have a VM that can run roughshod over the host. A spec with its "Security" section could help here.

In addition, this is being set via image property, which is user-controllable. I think a flavor extra spec would be more appropriate, as they are operator-defined.

Next up, scheduling. The proposed implementation is that if the VM lands on a host with a valid pm_channel_path set in the conf, then we add the relevant XML bits. An operator might want to have more control over scheduling, for example by exposing a virt-driver-controlled trait.

Then come the obvious questions of how we support VM operations. For example, live migration. We recently got NUMA live migration, but that obviously doesn't account for any VM power management.

So all in all, the use case is valid (in the context of the already un-cloudy telco/NFV world), but the feature needs some more design, methinks.

[1] https://dpdk-docs.readthedocs.io/en/latest/sample_app_ug/vm_power_management.html'}, {'account_id': 6873, 'date': '2019-11-10 21:10:30.000000000', 'content': "Abandoned

This hasn't been updated in nearly 2 years and would require a spec at least for the security impacts, so I'm going to abandon it."}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2017-10-17 20:20:36.000000000', 'message': "[WIP] Add a communication channel for power management support

Some network operators aim to reduce operational costs by tying power
consumption to the actual traffic flowing through their VNFs. These VNFs
can evaluate the required performance but also need a way to control
power related HW capabilities present on the host.

This patch configures the libvirt domain XML to include a virtio-serial
channel for power management purposes only, for VMs running on Qemu or
KVM and executing an image with the 'hw_power_governor' property.
Such channel can then be used by energy-aware applications in the guest,
run in combination with a matching power agent on the host for HW
control.

The DPDK project already provides a sample agent and application for
such purpose, DPDK based VNFs would benefit from improved support at the
orchestration layer.

TODO: improve testing

Implements: blueprint vm-power-management
Change-Id: I909827bdb542bffeecd0e694fadd94f650445db2"}, {'created': '2017-11-08 09:03:11.000000000', 'message': "Add a communication channel for power management support

commit_message:
Add a communication channel for power management support

Some network operators aim to reduce operational costs by tying power
consumption to the actual traffic flowing through their VNFs. These VNFs
can evaluate the required performance but also need a way to control
power related HW capabilities present on the host.

This patch configures the libvirt domain XML to include a virtio-serial
channel for power management purposes only, for VMs running on Qemu or
KVM and executing an image with the 'hw_power_governor' property.
Such channel can then be used by energy-aware applications in the guest,
run in combination with a matching power agent on the host for HW
control.

The DPDK project already provides a sample agent and application for
such purpose, DPDK based VNFs would benefit from improved support at the
orchestration layer.

Implements: blueprint vm-power-management
Change-Id: I909827bdb542bffeecd0e694fadd94f650445db2

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-11-07 11:29:22.000000000', 'message': "Fix `snmp` unit test

Under some condition, some code underneath `snmp` power driver
seems to call `sleep` for its own reason. That fails sleep
mock call assertion:

    AssertionError: Expected 'sleep' to be called once. Called 8 times.
    Calls: [call(0), call(0), call(0), ... call(0), call(5)].

This fix asserts just the sleep call we expect.

Change-Id: I2edec4cbea2d39910f1fb52b0373169c03a4ec0d
"}]
commit_message:
Fix `snmp` unit test

Under some condition, some code underneath `snmp` power driver
seems to call `sleep` for its own reason. That fails sleep
mock call assertion:

    AssertionError: Expected 'sleep' to be called once. Called 8 times.
    Calls: [call(0), call(0), call(0), ... call(0), call(5)].

This fix asserts just the sleep call we expect.

Change-Id: I2edec4cbea2d39910f1fb52b0373169c03a4ec0d

[{'created': '2019-11-01 12:50:35.000000000', 'message': "Fix Geneve max_header_size config option text

The max_header_size config option only applies to the
Geneve header itself, not the underlying IP/IPv6 header,
whose size is calculated separately. Remove a misleading
sentence and correct the help text to say '30'.

Trivialfix

Change-Id: If856bba4e61a6f1326138fc3a7ab29ce87c3ad04
"}]
commit_message:
Fix Geneve max_header_size config option text

The max_header_size config option only applies to the
Geneve header itself, not the underlying IP/IPv6 header,
whose size is calculated separately. Remove a misleading
sentence and correct the help text to say '30'.

Trivialfix

Change-Id: If856bba4e61a6f1326138fc3a7ab29ce87c3ad04

subject: Add container-image root element
messages: [{'account_id': 2, 'date': '2019-11-10 04:26:41.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2019-11-10 04:26:41.000000000', 'message': "Add container-image root element

Getting minimal starting filesystems is done via tools such as
debootstrap and yum on the host OS. This gets complicated as the
host OS then has to have appropriate verions of such tools for
given target image OSes, which is often not a priority for host
distros.

In the time since diskimage-builder was written, container images
have become prevalent, and there is, generally speaking, a container
image for every minimal root filesystem we'd like. Additionally,
since container image building tools are also prevalent, custom
container images can easily be used as an input for custom root
filesystems before applying diskimage-builder specific elements.

Add a container-image root element that creates a container based
on a given image name and then exports the contents of that over
TARGET_ROOT.

Change-Id: I1d9c510eded1ee49ce724f7257b15fc55c1e7a9a
"}]
commit_message:
Add container-image root element

Getting minimal starting filesystems is done via tools such as
debootstrap and yum on the host OS. This gets complicated as the
host OS then has to have appropriate verions of such tools for
given target image OSes, which is often not a priority for host
distros.

In the time since diskimage-builder was written, container images
have become prevalent, and there is, generally speaking, a container
image for every minimal root filesystem we'd like. Additionally,
since container image building tools are also prevalent, custom
container images can easily be used as an input for custom root
filesystems before applying diskimage-builder specific elements.

Add a container-image root element that creates a container based
on a given image name and then exports the contents of that over
TARGET_ROOT.

Change-Id: I1d9c510eded1ee49ce724f7257b15fc55c1e7a9a

commit_message:
tripleo-container-manage: fix exec check

Fix the task which check if the container where the exec happens is
actually running.

Also podman_containers needs to be refreshed at every start_order to get
new container informations status.
So moving podman_containers from main, and putting it where we need it:
- before processing the list of containers to delete
- when start_order playbook starts

Co-Authored-By: Sagi Shnaidman <sshnaidm@redhat.com>
Change-Id: I2afb71288208c8b97763caa832c94e06e1b9457c

commit_message:
Drop python2.7 support

As per the official python support timeline
set forth by the OpenStack TC [1], OpenStack
Train (in our case, manila-ui 2.19.x
series) is the last release that will support
python2.7.

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/#/c/688997/
[1] https://governance.openstack.org/tc/resolutions/20180529-python2-deprecation-timeline.html

Change-Id: I5b4dc1853d7e4f8f736dd2a22eb08bcfdeac3411

commit_message:
Fix the amqp presettle option for metrics and events in collectd

The values for presettle were incorrect for metrics and events sent
via AMQP.
Events should NOT be pre-settled, as they need to be ack'd to
ensure that all messages are delivered.
Metrics should be presettled as they don't require an ack.

Change-Id: I6aae1c8029cf6c9fff52a79d7a1519888f46dd81

commit_message:
Support undercloud fake-hardware ironic driver

When including fake-hardware in the undercloud.conf
enabled_hardware_types, some of the fake-hardware default interfaces
are not enabled so it can't be used.

This change allows nodes to be created with driver fake-hardware. If
this proves useful for development or some scale testing then it might
be desirable to add fake-hardware by default to the
enabled_hardware_types list.

Change-Id: I1a6b4df073b39924e6855ea865cfc856a1bdfe6b
Closes-Bug: 1851572
(cherry picked from commit 3657d1dc8deb77a097d591cc30bfed89292265fa)

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-10-29 16:04:15.000000000', 'message': 'Use admin neutron client to see if instance has qos ports

The nova-api checks at each move operation if the instance has qos port
attached as not all the move operations are supported for such servers.
Nova uses the request context to initialize the neutron client for the
port query. However neutron does not return the value of the
resource_request of the port if it is queried with a non admin client.
This causes that if the move operation is initiated by a non admin
then nova thinks that the ports do not have resource request.

This patch creates an admin context for this neutron query.

The new functional tests are not added before this patch in a regression
test like way as existing functional tests are reused with different
setup and doing that without the fix causes a lot of different failure
scenarios.

Note that neutron fixture is changed to simulate the different behavior
in case of different request context are used to initialize the client.

Change-Id: I3cf6eb4654663865d9258c38f05cd05974ffcf9d
Closes-Bug: #1850280
'}, {'created': '2019-10-29 16:20:45.000000000', 'message': 'Use admin neutron client to see if instance has qos ports

port query. However neutron does not return the value of the
resource_request of the port if it is queried with a non admin client.
This causes that if the move operation is initiated by a non admin
then nova thinks that the ports do not have resource request.

This patch creates an admin context for this neutron query.

The new functional tests are not added before this patch in a regression
test like way as existing functional tests are reused with different
setup and doing that without the fix causes a lot of different failure
scenarios.

Note that neutron fixture is changed to simulate the different behavior
in case of different request context are used to initialize the client.

Change-Id: I3cf6eb4654663865d9258c38f05cd05974ffcf9d

'}, {'created': '2019-11-06 20:57:09.000000000', 'message': 'Use admin neutron client to see if instance has qos ports

The nova-api checks at each move* operation if the instance has qos port
attached as not all the move operations are supported for such servers.
Nova uses the request context to initialize the neutron client for the
port query. However neutron does not return the value of the
resource_request of the port if it is queried with a non admin client.
This causes that if the move operation is initiated by a non admin
then nova thinks that the ports do not have resource request.

This patch creates an admin context for this neutron query.

The new functional tests are not added before this patch in a regression
test like way as existing functional tests are reused with different
setup and doing that without the fix causes a lot of different failure
scenarios.

Note that neutron fixture is changed to simulate the different behavior
in case of different request context are used to initialize the client.

*: Note that Id5f2f4f22b856c989e2eef8ed56b9829d1bcefb6 removed the check

'}]
commit_message:
Use admin neutron client to see if instance has qos ports

The nova-api checks at each move* operation if the instance has qos port
attached as not all the move operations are supported for such servers.
Nova uses the request context to initialize the neutron client for the
port query. However neutron does not return the value of the
resource_request of the port if it is queried with a non admin client.
This causes that if the move operation is initiated by a non admin
then nova thinks that the ports do not have resource request.

This patch creates an admin context for this neutron query.

The new functional tests are not added before this patch in a regression
test like way as existing functional tests are reused with different
setup and doing that without the fix causes a lot of different failure
scenarios.

Note that neutron fixture is changed to simulate the different behavior
in case of different request context are used to initialize the client.

*: Note that Id5f2f4f22b856c989e2eef8ed56b9829d1bcefb6 removed the check
   for evacuate in Ussuri but exists in Train and Stein.

Change-Id: I3cf6eb4654663865d9258c38f05cd05974ffcf9d
Closes-Bug: #1850280

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-11-08 00:20:06.000000000', 'message': 'Revert "Set display_skipped_host to no"

display_skipped_hosts=no has the unfortunate side effect of not showing
the running task name until the task has returned. The reason is b/c the
task name won't be shown at all if all hosts are skipped, but that won't
be known until the task returns.

For long running tasks, this can be quite misleading as the running task
name is not seen until it returns. This makes debugging difficult, and users
don't know what task is actually running until it's completed.

There is an option to show the task name as soon as it starts executing,
but it was not added until ansible-2.9:
https://github.com/ansible/ansible/pull/53819

See also https://github.com/ansible/ansible/issues/51042

This reverts commit 403535c5722cda7cdc7573b009046fb0c2f86c7c.

Change-Id: Ia9e291d476d3143b194ce06002a0c1745cf3ef94
(cherry picked from commit efe21cdecbba5a17dfe805e238865c8fd696c39d)
'}]
commit_message:
Revert "Set display_skipped_host to no"

display_skipped_hosts=no has the unfortunate side effect of not showing
the running task name until the task has returned. The reason is b/c the
task name won't be shown at all if all hosts are skipped, but that won't
be known until the task returns.

For long running tasks, this can be quite misleading as the running task
name is not seen until it returns. This makes debugging difficult, and users
don't know what task is actually running until it's completed.

There is an option to show the task name as soon as it starts executing,
but it was not added until ansible-2.9:
https://github.com/ansible/ansible/pull/53819

See also https://github.com/ansible/ansible/issues/51042

This reverts commit 403535c5722cda7cdc7573b009046fb0c2f86c7c.

Change-Id: Ia9e291d476d3143b194ce06002a0c1745cf3ef94
(cherry picked from commit efe21cdecbba5a17dfe805e238865c8fd696c39d)

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-10-23 01:32:54.000000000', 'message': 'fix: ceph-osd AppArmor profiles not applied

AppArmor annotations require the container name to be applied properly.
Before this when, when overrides are not used, the container name is
ceph-osd-default. When overrides are used, the container name is of the
form ceph-osd-HOSTNAME-SHA, but with an identical HOSTNAME and SHA for
all the daemonsets. However, it is not possible to predict this value,
and as a result, the AppArmor profiles are not applied.

This change removes the customization of the container name, and sets
it to ceph-osd-default, allowing AppArmor annotations to be consistently
applied using:

    pod:
      mandatory_access_control:
      type: apparmor
      ceph-osd-default:
        ceph-osd-default: localhost/profilename

Change-Id: I8b6eda00f77ec7393a4311309f3ff76908d06ae6

commit_message:
fix: ceph-osd AppArmor profiles not applied

AppArmor annotations require the container name to be applied properly.
Before this change, when overrides are not used, the container name is
ceph-osd-default. When overrides are used, the container name is of the
form ceph-osd-HOSTNAME-SHA, but with an identical HOSTNAME and SHA for
all the daemonsets. However, it is not possible to predict this value,
and as a result, the AppArmor profiles are not applied.

This change removes the customization of the container name, and sets
it to ceph-osd-default, allowing AppArmor annotations to be consistently
applied using:

    pod:
      mandatory_access_control:
        type: apparmor
        ceph-osd-default:
          ceph-osd-default: localhost/profilename

Change-Id: I8b6eda00f77ec7393a4311309f3ff76908d06ae6

commit_message:
Add auth_type to the ironic section of nova.conf

Without auth_type, nova cannot authenticate to keystone to see
available ironic hypervisors/create new baremetal boots.

Change-Id: I709230061de4a743e1efc50ee3dd8d3c3465f10b

commit_message:
PDF Documentation Build tox target

This patch adds a `pdf-docs` tox target that will build
PDF versions of our docs. As per the Train community goal:

  https://governance.openstack.org/tc/goals/selected/train/pdf-doc-generation.html

Add sphinxcontrib-svg2pdfconverter to doc/requirements.txt
to convert our SVGs.

Change-Id: I43fb85532d1bbf0316a10664116a3bbbd9fdc66a
Story: 2006105
(cherry picked from commit c462c02e38cda38ad76dd0dd7204dbc107e00ce6)

commit_message:
Update TOX/UPPER_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/train

Update the URL to the upper-constraints file to point to the redirect
rule on releases.openstack.org so that anyone working on this branch
will switch to the correct upper-constraints list automatically when
the requirements repository branches.

Until the requirements repository has as stable/train branch, tests will
continue to use the upper-constraints list on master.

Change-Id: I991a5e62275eb13d8c86c6908274e2baf3aeb4d4

Stop logging manifest in debug

It's excessively verbose and is a json object which leads to the log

this anymore.

messages: [{'account_id': 28619, 'date': '2019-11-06 12:44:57.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Cherry Picked from branch master.'}, {'account_id': 28008, 'date': '2019-11-06 13:22:50.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 25023, 'date': '2019-11-08 20:13:58.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2019-11-06 12:44:57.000000000', 'message': "Restart mysql when package is installed

When running galera_server role with galera_upgrade=true
it uninstalls mariadb and installs again. In some distros, like CentOS,
mariadb don't start automatically after installation, so upgrade fails.

This patch adds handler on packsage installation, which will be
triggered when package state is changed.

Change-Id: I23811cfaf23007c5da1860e78397be380d67403b
Related-bug: 1628720
(cherry picked from commit efc965f00fc515a46d03fcf22270ebc7bb8e4791)
"}]
commit_message:
Restart mysql when package is installed

When running galera_server role with galera_upgrade=true
it uninstalls mariadb and installs again. In some distros, like CentOS,
mariadb don't start automatically after installation, so upgrade fails.

This patch adds handler on packsage installation, which will be
triggered when package state is changed.

Change-Id: I23811cfaf23007c5da1860e78397be380d67403b
Related-bug: 1628720
(cherry picked from commit efc965f00fc515a46d03fcf22270ebc7bb8e4791)

commit_message:
Stop logging manifest in debug

It's excessively verbose and is a json object which leads to the log
lines not being individual lines. We don't really need to be printing
this anymore.

Change-Id: Ief83030835fa7e8c76ca2607135a4f840782bbb9
(cherry picked from commit 958937eb67e289f5da7e790d47dcd69011732a50)

healthcheck service. Let's make sure it's properly started as well.

commit_message:
Enable restart on config changed using coordinator

* Add initial config options
* Use coordinator to manage rolling restarts
* Factor out mysqlsh script execution
* Move to lib/charm/openstack to reuse charms.openstack features

Change-Id: I36ebfaba9a24d5edc6cee4ddc0a18a6580283e61

commit_message:
Fix debug hiera keys

The correct key to configure mistral debug is mistral::logging::debug
not mistral::debug. The same is true for heat, manila and sahara.

Change-Id: I382b472185f445e5d81077bc50b4c9cb65285530
Closes-Bug: #1851667
(cherry picked from commit cf3fa9d77dff583ba62484f21d1ca150cfb73ecf)

subject: No mixing of charm releases nor series versions
messages:
[{'account_id': 30561, 'date': '2019-11-07 20:29:24.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 11805, 'date': '2019-11-07 20:48:06.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

(3 comments)'}, {'account_id': 30561, 'date': '2019-11-07 21:10:11.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 11805, 'date': '2019-11-07 21:18:14.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

Looks good but I'd like thedac to take a look since he's the series upgrade guru.

This was also mentioned in the bug. Is it now documented somewhere? "The ceph-mon and ceph-osd charms should be updated to latest stable charm revs before taking on a migration or payload upgrade task. We should make the docs explicit about that."'}, {'account_id': 30561, 'date': '2019-11-07 21:21:15.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

I saw that too in the bug but the ceph charm migration appendix didn't seem like the place to put any of this stuff."}, {'account_id': 11805, 'date': '2019-11-07 21:21:45.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+1

The first sentence here does document it although could be argued that ceph charms aren't "openstack" charms but I think that's good enough. https://docs.openstack.org/project-deploy-guide/charm-deployment-guide/latest/app-upgrade-openstack.html#charm-upgrades

Just bounce the mixed series bit off thedac if you can. Or is it expected that the cloud is entirely offline for a series upgrade.'}, {'account_id': 20805, 'date': '2019-11-07 21:37:07.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

(1 comment)

I don't think this closes the bug. The update is in the install portion of the doc. We want to convey users should upgrade to the current release before some transformation like an upgrade or a migration.

This seems like it is in the wrong place."}, {'account_id': 30561, 'date': '2019-11-07 22:11:26.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

(1 comment)

David, if install-openstack is not the place then where? The upgrade-openstack already has it and app-ceph-migration concerns the installation of two new charms so I didn't include it there. Am I mistaken?"}, {'account_id': 20805, 'date': '2019-11-08 00:00:39.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

Peter, Ryan mentions both https://docs.openstack.org/project-deploy-guide/charm-deployment-guide/latest/app-ceph-migration.html and https://docs.openstack.org/project-deploy-guide/charm-deployment-guide/latest/app-series-upgrade.html.

Let's also make sure for openstack upgrade and charm upgrade we have a warning."}, {'account_id': 11805, 'date': '2019-11-08 13:41:23.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: -Code-Review

To cover this completely we should probably have a small note in the install section [1] and any upgrade sections.

[1] Perhaps better under: https://docs.openstack.org/project-deploy-guide/charm-deployment-guide/latest/install-openstack.html#deploy-openstack

Moving back to CR-0 while awaiting updates'}, {'account_id': 30561, 'date': '2019-11-08 16:49:38.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

Corey, yes exactly, we need a central place to put this and install-openstack is the one I found. I chose this specific location on that page because the introduction mentions installing via bundle. Those users to see this as well. I will add a note to the app-ceph-migration page as well.'}, {'account_id': 30561, 'date': '2019-11-08 17:08:18.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 20805, 'date': '2019-11-08 17:51:16.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

(1 comment)

Almost there, let's add the upgrade charm prompt to the openstack upgrade and the series-upgrade sections."}, {'account_id': 30561, 'date': '2019-11-08 18:25:03.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 4.'}, {'account_id': 20805, 'date': '2019-11-08 18:27:24.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1

Looks good. Merging.'}]

commit_message:
No mixing of charm releases nor series versions

I realise now that 'Charm upgrades' should be
on its own page as they can be done independently
of an OpenStack upgrade. A future PR may address
this.

Closes-Bug: #1811867

Change-Id: I6c9520ba2b81a358a66bdb0be92410c90dfaccf2

commit_message:
Detect if the network.service is available.

If not, then use the NetworkManager.service (for RHEL 8).

Change-Id: I27621ebb0fdc4e55aed19dbed7c0c924616fdd2f
Closes-Bug: 1851274
Signed-off-by: Luke Short <ekultails@gmail.com>

commit_message:
container-puppet: update 'env' when not null

Only update "env" if the content isn't null otherwise we'll have
container configs with:
"environment": null

And it causes problem later when we manipulate the config.

Change-Id: I0269a7ad0cf54e75dd25f8b3566ac0cab06fd93c

commit_message:
Add CloudSIG stein/train release files

Add release files for Testing CloudSIG stein/train repos [1][2].
These will be initially used to run a scenario001
job in RDO which will build containers for CloudSIG repos and then deploy
those containers.

[1] http://mirror.centos.org/centos/7/cloud/x86_64/openstack-stein/
[1] http://mirror.centos.org/centos/7/cloud/x86_64/openstack-train/

Change-Id: Ic300d137d628f65b1e0e7ab7a130b63bc83150fe

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-11-07 14:36:46.000000000', 'message': 'zuul: remove "files" for openstack-tox-tht

openstack-tox-tht is a dependency of functional testing jobs, which can
be problematic now because it only runs if some files are touched.

If e.g. common/container_puppet.py is the only file that is changed,
zuul will complain because the dependency graph is broken.

Let's relax openstack-tox-tht to run all the times; and stay a
dependency of other functional testing jobs (which brings value).

Change-Id: I3f05ca26064a2897a724876033a5cc4a602c38a2
'}]
commit_message:
zuul: remove "files" for openstack-tox-tht

openstack-tox-tht is a dependency of functional testing jobs, which can
be problematic now because it only runs if some files are touched.

If e.g. common/container_puppet.py is the only file that is changed,
zuul will complain because the dependency graph is broken.

Let's relax openstack-tox-tht to run all the times; and stay a
dependency of other functional testing jobs (which brings value).

Change-Id: I3f05ca26064a2897a724876033a5cc4a602c38a2

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-10-16 16:36:23.000000000', 'message': 'Do not validate neutron related side car container images.

Neutron spawns side car container when it needs them. In stein that
would be neutron-haproxy-ovnmeta which has an haproxy that relays
metadata queries.

When we run an update those side car container are not updated to not
disrupt services, so we add them to the list of container to not
check.

Change-Id: Ic1f46e1978bbb34f80aed8a761c38acedd040296
'}]
commit_message:
Do not validate neutron related side car container images.

Neutron spawns side car container when it needs them. In stein that
would be neutron-haproxy-ovnmeta which has an haproxy that relays
metadata queries.

When we run an update those side car container are not updated to not
disrupt services, so we add them to the list of container to not
check.

Change-Id: Ic1f46e1978bbb34f80aed8a761c38acedd040296

Yes if we don't use requirements_git_url no problem but if we use it, some variables (like here

 > requirements_git_url can be incorrect because of the url inside
 > default()

If we use requirement_git_url then some variables are builded from it, most of them use it directly. But utility_upper_constraints_url add /upper-constraints.txt at the end. revisions:
[{'created': '2019-10-23 20:38:52.000000000', 'message': 'Remove invalid dict entries from hashes.pkl

If the data in a hashes.pkl is corrupted but still de-serialized without
errors, it will mess up the replication and gets never fixed. This
happens for example if one of the keys is a NULL byte.

This patch checks if the dict keys in hashes.pkl are valid strings and
invalidates it if not.

Closes-Bug: 1830881
Change-Id: I84b062d062ff49935feed0aee3e1963bb72eb5ea
(cherry picked from commit c9e78d15e1e05f23facf7c28758b442bb25bde68)
(cherry picked from commit 46da6c1c01bc8beaf9a2b0a46122376b1bc7441f)
'}]
commit_message:
Remove invalid dict entries from hashes.pkl

If the data in a hashes.pkl is corrupted but still de-serialized without
errors, it will mess up the replication and gets never fixed. This
happens for example if one of the keys is a NULL byte.

This patch checks if the dict keys in hashes.pkl are valid strings and
invalidates it if not.

Closes-Bug: 1830881
Change-Id: I84b062d062ff49935feed0aee3e1963bb72eb5ea
(cherry picked from commit c9e78d15e1e05f23facf7c28758b442bb25bde68)
(cherry picked from commit 46da6c1c01bc8beaf9a2b0a46122376b1bc7441f)

commit_message:
Allow to specify custom version_hash

Handle branches with name containing cloudsig/.

Also allow passing vars to run-test role, this is
mainly needed when run-test role is called with zuul
playbooks and need to pass variables to it so it can
be forwarded to nested quickstart ansible.

Change-Id: Ia89f612540e50a4f917c57d6b85ceb28a73b09ff

commit_message:
Revert "Add nova to placement DB migration"

As nova_placement -> placement takes place in S->T upgrade,
we don't need this code anymore, as S->U is not supported anyway,
and T->U don't need placement to be migrated again

This reverts commit 3d6cedf85985ae9c658ee02f3c68c98e969c0f29.

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/692509
Change-Id: I281d8974ee22e65da8d03c6784bcbbbe79648351
